item.title: Fiber Is The New Infrastructure
item.description:
The current focus on infrastructure often overlooks a critical element: fiber optic broadband. While roads, bridges, and utilities are essential, fiber optic networks are the backbone of the 21st-century economy. Just as electricity revolutionized the 20th century, fiber optics will define this one. We’ve outgrown the limitations of traditional wireline systems. Fiber optic technology, with its capacity for high bandwidth, is the only way to meet the growing demand for data-intensive applications...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/fiber-is-the-new-infrastructure/

item.title: Are T1 Lines Obsolete?
item.description:
By: John Shepler Have you been relying on a T1 line for a long time? It’s understandable, given their long history. When the Internet was new, a T1 line provided businesses with a dependable, high-bandwidth connection that made dial-up modems seem incredibly slow. These days, similar bandwidth options are available at comparable prices, making those old T1 lines appear slow in comparison. So, are T1 lines still a viable business solution, or are they outdated?..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/are-t1-lines-obsolete/
